comments.body: ðŸ‘‹ @tu4mo could you please revert some changes caused by your local formatter? I mean `'` â†’ `"` and extra whitespace on some lines. This should make the diff smaller and thus the changes will be easier to review.

Hey @kachkaev! I used a separate commit for Prettier changes and you can also hide white-space changes from the cog-button. I can of course remove the formatting, but I was thinking that it would be better to conform to the Prettier config of DefinitelyTyped. What do you think?

https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#common-mistakes
https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/.prettierrc.json

Oh, seems like I missed https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/35672 ! Using Prettier myself too, just found it a bit strange that the PR was making both a semantic and a formatting change. In my projects, aligning with Prettier is usually done in isolated PRs to ease reviews.
